seasonalConsiderations.title: Peak Buying Season
seasonalConsiderations.description: Highest inventory but most competition. Best weather for inspections and moving.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Active Market Period
seasonalConsiderations.description: Good inventory levels and weather conditions. Ideal for family moves.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Motivated Sellers
seasonalConsiderations.description: Sellers motivated to close before winter. Good negotiating opportunities.

seasonalConsiderations.title: Reduced Activity
seasonalConsiderations.description: Lower inventory but less competition. Challenging for inspections and moving.

steps.title: Assess Your Financial Situation
steps.description: Evaluate your income, debts, and savings to determine your home buying budget

resources.title: CMHC Mortgage Calculator
resources.description: Calculate your maximum mortgage amount and monthly payments

resources.title: Financial Readiness Checklist
resources.description: Complete checklist to assess your financial readiness for home ownership

tips: Aim for a down payment of at least 10-20% to avoid CMHC insurance
Factor in closing costs of 2-4% of the home price
Consider pre-approval to understand your budget before house hunting

steps.title: Get Mortgage Pre-approval
steps.description: Obtain pre-approval from a lender to determine your buying power

resources.title: Mortgage Broker Network
resources.description: Connect with licensed mortgage brokers in Ontario

resources.title: Pre-approval Document Checklist
resources.description: List of documents needed for mortgage pre-approval

tips: Shop around with multiple lenders for best rates
Get pre-approval letter in writing
Understand the difference between pre-qualification and pre-approval

steps.title: Choose a Real Estate Agent
steps.description: Select a licensed real estate agent to represent you in the buying process

resources.title: RECO Agent Search
resources.description: Find licensed real estate professionals in Ontario

tips: Interview multiple agents before choosing
Check their recent sales history in your target area
Ensure they understand your budget and preferences

steps.title: Start House Hunting
steps.description: Begin searching for properties that meet your criteria

resources.title: MLS Listings
resources.description: Search active property listings in Ontario

tips: Make a list of must-haves vs. nice-to-haves
Consider future resale value
Visit neighborhoods at different times of day

steps.title: Make an Offer
steps.description: Submit a formal offer to purchase with conditions

resources.title: Agreement of Purchase and Sale (APS) Guide
resources.description: Understanding the standard Ontario purchase agreement

tips: Include financing and inspection conditions
Research comparable sales for pricing guidance
Be prepared for counteroffers

steps.title: Conduct Home Inspection
steps.description: Have the property professionally inspected for defects

resources.title: Certified Home Inspectors
resources.description: Find qualified home inspectors in your area

tips: Attend the inspection if possible
Review the report carefully before waiving conditions
Use findings to negotiate repairs or price adjustments

steps.title: Finalize Mortgage
steps.description: Complete mortgage application and secure final approval

resources.title: Mortgage Application Checklist
resources.description: Complete list of documents required for final approval

tips: Avoid making major purchases before closing
Provide all requested documentation promptly
Get mortgage commitment in writing

steps.title: Hire Real Estate Lawyer
steps.description: Engage a lawyer to handle legal aspects of the transaction

resources.title: Law Society of Ontario Directory
resources.description: Find licensed real estate lawyers in Ontario

tips: Hire a lawyer experienced in real estate transactions
Get fee estimate upfront
Ensure they can accommodate your closing timeline

steps.title: Final Walkthrough
steps.description: Inspect the property one final time before closing
tips: Check that agreed-upon repairs were completed
Verify all included fixtures and appliances are present
Test major systems (heating, plumbing, electrical)

steps.title: Complete the Purchase
steps.description: Sign final documents and receive keys to your new home
tips: Bring certified funds for closing costs
Review all documents before signing
Get copies of all important documents

governmentPrograms.title: First-Time Home Buyer Incentive
governmentPrograms.description: Shared equity mortgage from the Government of Canada
eligibility: Mortgage plus incentive cannot exceed 4x household income

governmentPrograms.title: HST New Housing Rebate
governmentPrograms.description: Rebate on HST paid for new or substantially renovated homes
eligibility: Purchasing new or substantially renovated home
benefits: Up to $24,000 rebate on HST paid
governmentPrograms.applicationProcess: Apply to Canada Revenue Agency within 2 years

governmentPrograms.title: Home Buyers' Plan (HBP)
governmentPrograms.description: Withdraw up to $35,000 from RRSP for home purchase
eligibility: First-time home buyer (or haven't owned home in past 4 years)
benefits: Up to $35,000 per person ($70,000 for couples)
